text:
- We're a consulting
partner so we work primarily

with SaaS businesses
that are building on AWS.
So the engagement with Learnerbly
who are a learning platform.

Through well architected
reviews, we learned that
onboarding new developers onto their team
was fairly time consuming.

We also learned that
there were some security,
not major sort of security deficiencies,
but things that would definitely flag
as part of an ISO audit.
Through having gone through that

well architected review
process, we provided them
with a list of recommendations.
We helped them to prioritize those based
on which we thought was more important

as far as their business
goals were concerned
and then we worked through those things.
We used Control Tower to provide

a really good sort of
foundation of practice
for their security stories.
And we can bring that experience to bear

for customers like Learnerbly
who then don't need

to spend their time worrying
about things that are

not business differentiating
features for them.

Learnerbly are really very
well setup for future growth.

They're in a position now where
onboarding new developers is
quick and easy, very cost effective.

They can scale their
team up without worrying
the structural components that they use
are gonna get in the way.

That level of confidence
that they can provide

to their buyers pays
off in the sales cycle.
